thread.title: Flood alert in Bramhall, Stockport, Sale, Altrincham and Urmston
thread.title_full: Flood alert in Bramhall, Stockport, Sale, Altrincham and Urmston

author: Charlotte Cox
title: Flood alert in Bramhall, Stockport, Sale, Altrincham and Urmston
text:
Flood alert in Bramhall, Stockport, Sale, Altrincham and Urmston Environment Agency does not anticipate flooding around the River Mersey - but asks residents to be prepared Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Flooding in Timperley village after Storm Doris hits Share this video Get daily   
A flood alert has been placed on areas of Bramhall , Stockport , Sale , Altrincham and Urmston . 
Applied by the Environment Agency on Thursday afternoon, the low level alert for the Middle River Mersey catchment area means flooding is possible and residents should be prepared. 
It comes as river levels continued to rise today as Storm Doris battered the region, bringing 70mph winds. 
River levels were forecast to reach their highest levels on Thursday afternoon. 
A spokesman from the Environment Agency said: “We are currently not anticipating any flooding to property. We will continue to monitor and will update this message as the situation develops. We are out clearing debris screens to minimise potential blockages and flow restriction.” Storm Doris caused flooding in Timperley village (Photo: Neil Taylor) 
Some residents reported concerns about rising water levels on the River Irwell this afternoon. 
However, there are no flood alerts or warnings in place in the city centre. 
A spokeswoman from added: “There has been heavy rain further up the river which has caused it to rise quite rapidly around New Bailey Street in Manchester city centre. 
“However it has not hit any of our triggers for a flood alert or warning and we now expect the river level to start dropping.” Read More
